biogHist.abstract: Cundeelee mission and school, north of Zanthus on the Nullabor, was established by the Australian Aborigines' Evangelical Mission in 1949. It was run by interdenominational churches until 1982, when it became an Aboriginal Community. Cundeelee accommodated children up to primary school age as well as families.
biogHist.p: Cundeelee was established by the Australian Aborigines' Evangelical Mission (AAEM) in 1949, reportedly to discourage Aboriginal people from 'begging' on the trans-Australian railway line. From around 1939 to 1948 there had been a government 'feeding depot' for Aboriginal people on the site. When the AAEM offered to establish a mission, they were actively encouraged by the Department of Native Affairs.

In 1952, a sandalwood licence was issued to Cundeelee, and youth and men from the mission worked on the 'Sandalwood Project' as it was known in the Department of Native Affairs. A photograph taken in 1957 has a caption that states Aboriginal youth were being paid for collecting sandalwood.
By the early 1980s, the Cundeelee property was vested in the Aboriginal Lands Trust and was later leased to Upurl Upurlia Ngurratja.

chronItem.event: Location - Cundeelee Mission was located at Cundeelee

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Department of Aboriginal Affairs [predecessors], Records, Department of Aboriginal Affairs (1886 - 2004)
Robert Capp interviewed by John Bannister in the Bringing them home oral history project (2000)

descriptiveNote.p: Robert McKeich, who had established Katukutu Employment Hostel, had also been involved in establishing Cundeelee.
Teenage girls from Cundeelee were able to live at Fairhaven Hostel in Esperance while going to high school or work.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Churches of Christ 'Fairhaven' Hostel, Esperance'

archref.abstract: 'Churches of Christ 'Fairhaven' Hostel, Esperance' is a history of the Churches of Christ's management of Fairhaven. It was written by Deslee Moyle, who has preserved many archival records relating to the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board (CCFAMB) and the organisation that followed it, the Australian Churches of Christ Indigenous Ministries (ACCIM). The item gives insight into life at Fairhaven and associated church activities in Esperance. The item also mentions the AAEM Hostel, Esperance; Condingup (Working Boys' Hostel); Norseman Mission, Cundeelee, and Wongutha.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Cundeelee Mission [picture]

archref.abstract: 'Cundeelee Mission [picture]' is a collection of six images showing children and adults at Cundeelee. Thse images are from the State Library of Western Australia's Robert McKeich collection of photographs.

archref.abstract: 'Cundeelee [picture]' is a collection of two images showing buildings at Cundeelee. These images are from the State Library of Western Australia's Robert McKeich collection of photographs.
